intro: Phlomoides mogianica, commonly known as the Mogiana phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its small, tubular flowers are typically purple or violet in color, arranged in whorls along the stem. It is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
